multiplicity3.input

Interface IMultiTouchEventListener

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICursorOverlay, ICursorTrailsOverlay, IMultiTouchInputFilter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DemoTrackedApp, EarlyYearsTrackedApp, EnvironmentExplorerTrackedApp, FlickGameApp, FlickStudyApp, GestureDetectionBehaviour, Gravity, GravitySim, InertiaBehaviour, ItemDragAndDropWorker, KeyboardBehaviour, LittleFishes, LoggingFilter, MoveBetweenContainerBehaviour, MultiTouchEventAdapter, MultiTouchEventDispatcher, MultiTouchInputComponent, MysteriesApp, NetworkFlickBehaviour, NumberNetTracked, PickedItemDispatcher, PTMListener, RotateTranslateScaleBehaviour, SingleInputFilter, StickerbookTrackedApp, TablePosApp, ThreeDRotateInteraction, TrackedApp, TrainTracksTrackedApp

    public interface IMultiTouchEventListener
    Defines possible input from a MultiTouch table. Eventually this interface would be extended to support new aspects of MultiTouch tables such as RFID proximity, hand area detection and bluetooth devices. For Cursors, the order of events for a click is: cursorPressed, cursorClicked, cursorReleased.
    Author:
    dcs0ah1

      • cursorClicked

        void cursorClicked(MultiTouchCursorEvent event)
        Cursor clicked. The sensitivity of the clicking detection is the responsibility of the appropriate IMultiTouchInputService. Event order is cursorPressed, cursorReleased, cursorClicked.
        Parameters:
        event -
